Blog.post: Great weekend! Friday went not so well, because nick had some amp problems... But saturday rocked! I can't believe how many people were at the Homestead! The ad in the paper worked! We played for tips, but made a tidy sum on them. Well, at least covered our gas to get out there. If you were there and liked us, tell your favorite bartenders about us! We got video, we got pictures. Got lined up on doing another wedding. We were only set on stun.. The two songs we learned this week went over very well. Keep watching for us... we try to add new songs every week. We still don;t have a complete set, but give us a few more months, maybe two, and we'll be up and running full force. We have originals we are working on, too.

The wonderful Lascivious Loretta ... or perhaps her husband, will be there at Mary's on Friday to videotape us, so we will at least have that for a demo. Also, i did hear that one of the bar owners in town is interested in seeing us, so she may be there, too. As long as the friends we have at Mary's keep talking us up, things should go well. We really do rock, if i do say so myself. I have not been seeing the flyers up that i so nicely asked owners of establishments to PUT UP. What meanies. Loretta and Tom are also going to head out to the Homestead on Saturday to see us. Thursday afternoon, the band will have a quick cram-jam to nail the two songs we just learned so we can add them in on Friday. Then, it's haul the stuff up to Mary's and set it up for Friday.
hmm. something appears to be WRONG here.

Scuse me, the bottom post should be changed to April 26th. Also confirmed is the Homestead Tavern, in Fairview, on the following Saturday, April 27th. As soon as we get the schwag designed, we will be offering goodies for any interested people at Cafepress.com, so be sure and check back. A link directly to the online store will be posted. Meat Bee fans rejoice! So, from the Department of Rendundancy Department of Manifest List , once again, for good measure~ 4/26, Mary's Riverside Tavern, between the 11th and 12th mile markers on the Allegany side of the Coos River, 9 PM. 4/27, The Homestead Tavern, about 3 miles out from Four Corners on the way to Laverne Park. Gnarly drives both times, so drive safe! You are our fanbase, and we wouldn't want to lose ANYONE to the tree gods! The band has been working on some new material, things to make you DANCE! Get your shakin shoes on and head out!

Once again, this is the page for my band, our adventures, news, gigs, etc. Coming up on May 27th, be sure to make the trip up to Mary's Riverside Tavern in Allegany to see us shake the walls down again.

Friday's wedding went..... okay. It was great and everyone appreciated that we learned the song we hated and we played it well but the band, to me, really seemed to be elsewhere. In my opinion, there were only a couple of *great* band moments... not including this one~ Parking was weird. Everyone just parked in the yard. There are 3.4 acres of yard, though, but those acres were crammed full of cars. I parked somewhere i figured i'd be safe and able to move if i had to.. so later i have to, and i'm carefully trying to unwedge myself from between two brand new cars on either side of me and one old truck behind me. Not, yknow, particularly worried about my own truck, but it was a hard place to get out of. In reverse, check all the mirrors for side clearance, check rear-view, peer out window, let off the clutch, gently .... gently.... CRASH yeah i hit a wedding members truck. Left some paint on his bumper. he was parked in a stupid place, though. MY truck, though, has a fist sized dent in the tailgate and some blue scratches across the top of the tailgate. no damage done, really.. more comic relief for a stressful day, i guess. but still, now everyone up there is gonna call me Crash. They've already started.

Band practice today! Also changed the obnoxious color of the page. I couldn't look at the yellow anymore. Soon, i hope to replace the rocks with pictures of each of us. Possible leads for us: Lloyd's of Bandon IS interested in us. The band at the Blue Moon wants a break, so i hear. New owner at the Homestead. Jeef has talked to the people at the Fun Fest and the Gay 90s festival. I'm supposed to handle the rest (of course) We can go up and play any old time at Mary's. If you know any of these places, or frequent them, blab about us.

In case you missed it, the List went out today. If you aren't already on it, you should be able to click on the "get on the list!" link off to the left, there. We think we might have something going for Coquille's Gay 90s deal. Not sure. Check out Gluttn over at the Bachelor's Inn on Sunday nights. Some pure rocknroll fury outta Danny. Good stuff. Silverhawk has also been rocking. Saw them last week, once at the Wanda's jam and then again on Saturday night. The new stuff is great, guys :) The inimitable BeBe Bardot has gigs all summer down at Lord Bennett's too, to round out the local rocknroll experience.. And, as usual, a plug for my favorite place in town, Mary's Riverside Pub in Allegany. Great food. Wednesday music anarchy. Sunday games (Cribbage tournament this month.. beat Neil and Pancake for some serious bragging rights). Last night's practice was mediocre.. we're all recovering from some nasty cold. I was the last to get it. We did, however, get two new songs nailed down, and a good grip on another one. yeah, not much about the band in this post. Just wasting some time here, givin props to all my friends and the like.
We got the Run. Friday the 19th. Six PM. Be there, or be elsewhere. And April is also going to be seen yukking it up with BeBe Bardot at his Lord Bennett's B-day Bash in Bandon on 7/5.

ahhh.. i love the riverside, even though the patrons all moan about how we're too loud. Well, yeah, and most of the people who have seen us in there know we're loud, and i don't see why they come if they're just going to complain about something they already know about. There is no line we can draw with our equipment in that place to get the guitar sound we like, get over the drums, and have Tammi heard. the place is just too small with too many weird angles. soooooo anyway, those of you who missed it, we did lay out a rough version of BTO's "Let it Ride". Except it's Big Sugar's version of the song, which rocks 10 million times more. We think it'll be well-received! My friend Dean came up and brought his recording equipment, and he has some nice stuff. We ran the bass straight from the amp into the mixer, and the vocals straight into the mixer, and Dean set up two ambient mikes to catch the rest, and i have to say, the dirty, straight recording sounded damn good. I can't wait until he cleans it up. Beeb was there (heya Beeb! Thanks for comin! We LOVED it! I think everyone else did, too!) and we jammed a song with him and it rocked. I even played my part perfectly, which i was unable to do the last time we jammed together, for whatever reason. Nick's dad was able to come up, and that was really cool. So far, Ron's the only parent whos been able to see us. (sad face). Mine live out of state, Tammi's mom lives kinda far away, and Jeff's mom lives kinda far away, too. But soon, probably in the next week or so if all goes well with Dean, we'll have a CD we can send our families, and whoever else might want one. It'll be the show at the Riverside, the best songs we did that night. These are all covers, so we can't sell this. Just ask, once i give the word, and i'll get a CD to you. There is a little bit of a waiting list, right now.. ah, still working on scanning the logo for the shirts. i have not perfected it yet. I do the artwork by hand, being of the old-school DIY punk-rock type ethic. I haven't been able to balance and straighten it to my liking yet. Onward... The Coos River Run, i am assuming it is ON. I'm pretty sure that Friday night is going to be John Chamberlin and a guy named Jack. John's a great git player, so he's worth seeing. More on this later... Musical progress- Our first original is going to probably be a re-working of the song i wrote and often sing with Beeb, Home. It's also going to be available soon. Well, the original version of it is. That'd be all the fits that's news to print, guys.

I don't know who's going to be playing Friday. Something makes me think it's Bev and Jerry's Brick Pig Family Blues band. It could be the Joneses or it might even be Bigfoot Blues. I wish i knew! ahhh.. the big mystery...

Finally got the band to do a Big Sugar song! Actually, we have two we're going to work on, but we worked on the best one tonight. Y'all should recognize it, even if you've never heard of these guys. Learning it tonight made me realize what a kickass band we really are! We'll add it to the set at the Coos River Run. It'll rock. Trust me! and while you're waiting around... buy some Big Sugar!

Excellent News! We're on for the Coos River Run, as far as i know. We talked to one of the guys last night. Of course, i didn't set this up. The rest of the band did, i just did some leg work on it here and there, but i guess we're on for Saturday. I don't know all the details. I wish i did. Will email this out as soon as the email address is working again (damn thing. I may just get another one). The run is July 19, 20 and 21. we've got three new songs to blow-dry your hair with. And finally started work on an original. April recorded this original with BeBe Bardot this last week, and she actually sounds kinda good singing. In a Bob Dylan sort of way, i guess.
ok.. come see us the 15th! We'll be starting between 5 and 6.
Next gig is coming up at Mary's again, on June 15th. We'll start playing probably about 5 or so. It's a Mexican Potluck to celebrate all the June Birthdays. Hope to see y'all there!
Hey the Coos River Run was fun as hell and we hope we get to do it again. If you missed it, poor you :P Pictures should be forthcoming. Got one roll back but they were icky.

the stupid mp3 isn't working yet. Sorry. We played at the Coquile Valley BPOE #1935 Annual Golf Tournament on Saturday. It went pretty well, considering.. ... that we got called to do it the day before ... that the average age of the audience members was 70 It was a good little gig, though. I'll tell ya, the elks have it made down there, they have their own golf course!

Still haven't fixed the MP3. I have no idea what the problem is. Shoot me an email if you want it and i'll email it to you. Yeah, long process, i know, but it's all i can do right now. I thought of going onto audiogalaxy at a certain time for a few hours and letting anyone who uses it grab it. Any takers?

i'm not sure whats going on and why you can't download the song. Harborside is having problems with a T1 in Brookings, but i don't see what that has to do with this. I'll keep trying. Someone else try, and if you can or can't get it, send me an email at reebdogpril@partlycloudy.com, please :) (later...) ok i think its a problem with harborside. The filename path is right. It is where it says it is. the HTML is right, as far as i've been able to tell... I'll keep bashing away at this until i get it fixed.
oh fer chrissakes. urlLink Fortunate Son

trying this again urlLink Fortunate Son You can download this file and keep it on your hard drive for 24 hours. Then you have to delete it. That's the law. And none of us EVER break the law, right? ____ This was recorded by Dean McCoy on 6/15/02. Its nothing fancy. We just love to play this song.

oh, hey, someone was searching for "version of let it ride song" and came across this page... So, lemme just say that the version you may be looking for is by Big Sugar and is available on the "heated" album, and i do seriously recommend getting that album, and any OTHER Big Sugar albums that may be available in your area. Each of us band members is grounded in different music- Jeff loves 80s metal. That's where he's from, musically. Tammi likes a lot of stuff, a lot of classic rock, just GOOD music in general. Nick, the l'il bro of the band, grew up on Green Day and music from the early 90s. And I love all kinds of stuff. But firmly rooted in 80s punk rock and dirty blues. And all of us adore Big Sugar. And it shows in how we approach the band, our gigs, what we play, how we play, and our general attitude about music. because, as the Mighty Gordie says, There is no alternative to rock n roll

Fun Fest News Well, we're on for the Sunday slot, from 2 to 6 PM. We're kinda hoping we can move it to Saturday, but who knows. Sunday is good enough. It'll be a blast! For anyone who saw us wa-a-a-a-y back when (march! haha) at the Homestead, seeing us now would be an experience, because we're 500% better, so come check us out! We've added a ton of new stuff that'll make you HAPPY! we like happy. The Fun Fest is in downtown Coos Bay and runs on the 20th, 21st and 22nd of September. We're working on something for Tad's. Lloyd's totally blew us off. Their loss. :) Hear that, dude who owns lloyd's?! YOUR LOSS! Muahahaha. Oh and ALL the pics we had done at the run turned out icky. The light was not conducive... in that the shadow from the canopy on the stage cut all our heads off.

Oof, been a while, eh? NEWS! I guess we're playing at the Fun Fest! That'll be fun. No idea when yet, but i'll put it here when i find out. This kind of snuck up on me, personally. hehe. Should be oodles of joy, though. Tons of people. wee! other stuff for now, i have removed the MP3. i haven't had the time to get on harborside about why it didn't work, and i haven't checked to see if it worked. So, hang on, it'll be there eventually. Also lost my scanner access, but hopefully we'll be able to have some stickers or hats or something for sale. we have a logo now !
bahah we aren't as RAD as those guys, because we have no band pictures. hey, man... as soon as someone can get some, we will, though. *Grinz* We keep breakin cameras or something...
urlLink Black Chrome vs. Death Mask And these are the guys who we are trying to work out some shows with. Should be interesting, AT LEAST! :)

urlLink Downshift This is the band that played before us at the Fun Festival. I missed them, so y'all are gonna have to go see them for yourselves. I DID say i was going to add links to local bands, and here is the beginning.

Minor change alert: The old email address for the band, manifest_list at dazedandconfuseddotcom is gonna be toast here as soon as i can get in and read the mail that's there. It's a crummy service, and i haven't been able to read email to it in about a week. New address off to the right.

great. With a template change, the page is up and running again. I'll have to tweak it to my satisfaction later, but this works for now. The Fun Fest went great. Lots of people got pictures, we'll see if any turn out. urlLink Dale did a fantastic job running the sound. People liked us. People showed up to see us who i certainly didn't expect to, and best of all.... we got PAAAAID!
Haven't been able to update this much, mostly due to problems with blogger.. If this post goes through, later i will let everyone who missed the Fun Fest yesterday didn't get to see...

well, we haven't had much to say except "Go to the fun fest on the 22nd!" So, i, as webmistress, am going to do something to support other artists in the area. I'm going to add links to their websites, if they have them.

Yow! We're still alive, still playing, although only at the house. Just a reminder that we're gonna be at the Coos Bay Fun Fest on September 22 (That's a Sunday) from 2 to 6 at the main stage in front of City Hall, downtown. If you've emailed us at the dazedandconfused.com address, i've had problems with it. Like, i can't always log in because.. well... they suck. That's all. We played a wedding a couple of weeks ago in Myrtle Point. At the fairgrounds. We had the whole fairground to ourselves. It was great! We seem to fill an odd little niche around here that isn't getting filled.
urlLink Tomo's pictures from last Saturday
urlLink This is for Tammi.

More fun than shootin fish in a barrel Hoooey. Just got back. Here's my personal review: ML (just picture me tooting my horn, or greasing my head to leave because it was too big to squeeze through the door) Silverhawk As usual, fan-fucking-tastic. Avogadro's Number Ooh. FINALLY got to see these guys, and now i know what all the hoo-hah was about. Dude makes me wanna put my bass away and cry. (as if... I will torture people with my playing as long as i have fingers). Muffalo I think they only played three songs? But they were three damn cool ones. Black Chrome vs. Death Mask Had no clue what to expect from these dudes, but it wasn't disappointing. Zero Set They cancelled. I was bummed. I wanted to see them. DJ Josh McGrady Last, and certainly not least, the man played some seriously rad shit, and i'd hire him in a sheep's eye if i ever needed a DJ. Tomo took what looked like tons of pictures and is going to put them on Avagadro's Numbers web page, so when they're up i'll link to them. There were a lot of really great costumes, too! There are probably a lot of pictures of those, too. So, it was a rad show. I hope we get to do more stuff like that. We were the odd ones in that we played covers and everyone else has originals... but, hey man, our covers are cooooool. thbbbbbt. (i was kinda self-concious about that. Erm, i'm an idiot though and can be self-concious about some stupid shit) And Dale got to hang around and see us! *Smooch* He didn't get to run the board for us, but it was nice that he got to come see us, since he usually has to work on the nights we play. Next Weekend: Saturday 11/2 we're off to rattle some glassware at Tad's in fabulous downtown urlLink Coquille

Go to Roger's! If you go in costume, it's a buck off. These are the bands that are playing. urlLink Avagadro's Number , Zero Set (sorry guys, i'm not searching through eleven pages on Google to scare up your web page, if you have one), Muffalo (yikes, the stuff that Google brings back for THAT one..), urlLink Silverhawk , urlLink Black Chrome vs. Death Mask and DJ Josh (?) McGrady. ok, i have a flyer in the back room. I'm just TOOOOO lazy to go get it.

Chaos reigns at Roger's Zoo, October 26th! Six bands and a DJ! Six bucks! Costume party! Stuff giveaway! And... i almost forgot... there will be a guy there running horror movies on one of the walls... Man, this IS my favorite holiday :)

Morning Fastlane, Hershey Bar, and the Jade Plant last night i sporadically worked on some stuff for the cafe press store. without a scanner, the stuff is ugly. I'd rather do drawings by hand and use them than struggle with PSP. All i've got right now is a sticker, and i'm takin it out today and tryin to add some more stuff instead. Maybe by the end of the week, there will be something up for sale. What's up with the MP3 you may ask.. well, that annoyed me, and when something annoys me that much, i don't tend to deal with it again for a while. Plus, it's embarassing now to listen to that CD, because i think we're so much better. I don't really want to share it. Hrm. If the rest of the band wants to, i soitinly will, but for now, no. Its terrible.

Roger's tentatively confirmed for 10/26, but i gotta call John back. Read down. looks like phone-tag. *chortle* we'll be playing with BC vs DM and, hopefully, a scratch-mix DJ they know. I hope its DJ Edit. woowoo. It'll be three completely different kinds of tuneage.
Rolling Wreck at Roger's Got some ideas for dates with Black Chrome vs. Death Mask. 10/17 or 10/18, or 10/25. That's all we know for now. Densmore's gonna call back. Sounds fun as hell.

Get offa my porch or i'm callin the cops, tread Yeeeee we finally wrote a song of our own :o Actually, we had the words and chord structure for a few weeks. It was only a day or so ago that it got worked on any. I gotta say, It rocks . If this goes through with Black Chrome vs. Death Mask, we're hoping to have the song ready to play by then. Y'know, my band freakin roolz. *strut*

Null Not much happening. We have nothing set up for November as of yet, and a private party for mid-december, and a tentative New Year's show. Actually, this is, unfortunately, all tentative unless some things get worked out. the last gig at Tadd's went okay. We all played well, etc.
Rock n Roll most of the night Saturday November 2- at Tadd's in Coquille. 90 W. 1st St. Starts at 9, ends when we're done. wee!

Well, everything has sort of ground to a halt. We're not playing anywhere NYE. (Which i'm immeasurably bummed about, but only because of my disease... that need to play in front of people). Tammi has torqued her back up. Nick is starting school. So, when/if we start back up again, info will be forthcoming.
Finally, some band pictures. None of us together yet. These were from the party Saturday night. Which, by the way, we ROOLED.
We can dream, right? Besides, i always wanted to do this.
And now..... A picture of a picture of the band. Sorry. The closest we could get right now :o
ok the local band links i have added are about to scroll, so, tonight i will add them to the side.

Don't nail that coffin shut, yet We've been busy, individually, and not-so-busy as a band. Things were sort of on hold a bit with Thanksgiving, i guess, and some other stuff, and we are unsure what's happening with the holidays. Good news- We are going to be playing at the urlLink World's Christmas party this weekend. Today i went and measured out the stage, asked for more room, checked out the acoustics (no way we'll be buggin the bar, as far as i can see...) and figured out where the outlets were. More good news - Our first original song is probably 3/4 done. We're still working out the chorus. Well, it's changed a bit from how i wrote it, and i still have my version in my head, so i screw up when we work on it... but, it's coming along nicely. Working title is "Get the Hell Offa My Porch or I'm Calling the Cops, Tread". Bad news- There is no bad news!

urlLink Peter Pan's Home Page! This is just for tammi. I think i was telling Tam about it a couple of days ago. I first found this last year as a link in an email from someone, and now urlLink Dave Barry has it on his page. Careful if your in a public place...
ooooh nooooooo! Beware , for only I hef de power to put pictures here... (dun dun duunnn) muahaha!
hell yeah. i finally have the power!!!!!!!!!! the following is the correct spelling of mah name: t a m m i {{for those generous souls who give a crap}}
Yay everybody has their own page now. The pages are still fugly, but the point is, they're there.

Free Souls gig went fabulous. They want us back. (of course.. would there be any other option?) I also started working on our individual pages. Nick's is the only one up so far. Just click on his name over there --->

Upcoming gigs I'm quick this way. I got torqued on my birthday AND managed to book a gig with the fine folks who put up with the "kiss my ass" song and dance for 20 minutes. I think i got help from Jeff and Tam, though. So, January 18 we'll be gettin rowdy at the Free Souls MC club out on Empire Blvd. Its next to the Fleetwood. Or, the Fleftwood, as some may remember it. This is a private club but we can have our fans come out. They do serve liquor, on a donation basis. While you are there, you will probably be asked to buy a sticker or button from the club. They're cheap, so go ahead and buy one. These dudes are nice guys. They didn't toss me out on my birthday, and i would have surely tossed me out. February 14 once again with Sam and John Densmore and their bands at Roger's Zoo in downtown North Bend. I have no details other than we're playing there. The fabulous DJ will be there again, too. When more is known, i'll put it here. We're finally got "Tread" into its final stages. We smoothed out a couple of rough bits on it this week, played it through 80 million times, and i do believe its ready for the big time. So, hopefully, we'll be playing it at both of those gigs. We're also about to start on a song Tammy wrote about a week ago. Someone said, and i think it was Jeff, that after you write one song, it gets easier. Seems to be the case :)
oh yeah and don't be afraid to use the tag board. it doesn't bite. I'm sure Tomo still has all his important parts.

Yup, its on. March 22 (saturday) at the Free Souls clubhouse in Empire again. Open to the public, no cover charge. 9 PM. Be there or be elsewhere. See ya. I'll have the flyer up here in about a day or two. Its the only really good one i've done. apropos of nothing factoid : Those songs you get stuck in your head, the ones that drive you insane... Germans call them "earworms". I think thats Ohrewurmen. (umlauted u?)

Until further notice: I'm done booking, i've made my last flyer, all calls for us to play will be forwarded to other members of the band. The energy i have for that has to go into something else for awhile. It has very little to do with the band, but it ain't nobody's bidness but my own. I'll keep up the page and the mailing list.

Speaking of pics, I was devastated to discover that the beauteous seedy, run down, partially torn up hotel in Bunker hill that we were gonna photo shoot at has been torn down all the way!!! since when does a hideous project like that get accomplished in a timely manner??? well, in "Overboard" lingo, 'way to hustle, guys'.... yes, our shows this weekend were definately fun.. we also got the added pleasure of watching Chris and his new band, 'Downshift' perform, when our gig at the Freesouls club was breifly turned into a kamikaze jam session. Thanks for the break, guys! The contrast they provided was nice too. Definately a good evening....i really like those 'souls, they treated us dam good. Tonight we begin building our album, as it is TIME!!!!! see y'all later...i'm going to attempt to wax an aging ford pickup with oxidized, chalklike brown metallic paint.....actually, at this point i think i'll wash it down with gas, then do an allover spritz with armorall!!!! luv, t

oooh... *chortling gleefully* urlLink This is the flyer from Valentine's day.. ok its late... Sam caused a bit of a stir with it. Seems, i guess, some folks found it offensive. I have the other flyer he put up, too. Its cool, but this one is just cooler.
hrm ok gonna add some more pics tonight. I'll keep working on making everyone's page purty, too. We didnt get any playing at the zoo...

what a fantastic weekend, man. Good shows, guys! And i have a confession to make. There are days that i want to choke the living shit out of everyone in the band.. (of course, its hard to wrap your hands around your own throat and squeeze...) but, Lawd have mercy! Shows the like two we just had, it's all worth it. (pops open bottle of Andre's Pink Duck Champagne stuff) Here's to CheeseRock and the closet Mulletudes!

(in an eric cartman voice)...."Whatevah....! Foff!!!!!" would all those with an opinion line up , please , so that i may squeeze their heads if i want to hear it??? Sarah rulez.. hey it's our big day, gotta practice so we don't suck.. rumor has it that Pril daddio has written another song.....looking forwrd to it!! well, rock on you fellow cockrockerettes!

Check this out: Sara is a fan. I guess they had a corporate Valentine's Day party where Shawn works and whoever put it on hired some terrible DJ... for $500 . Everyone was disappointed with him. Sara let the party organizers know they could have had a rad live band for our price. They proceeded to kick themselves all over the mall parking lot. Sara rocks. It's cool having a friend work in the local paper's advertising dept. Well, she loves me, so she's gonna foam us up whenever she has the chance. You'll have to come up and see her with me some time. And Nick can rummage through Shawn's cords for that one he lost.
har har! Revenge is mine! No need to make it up to me later! The tweeker came back to bother you ! (insert several minutes of gut-busting schadenfreude-filled laughter)

au contraire, mon sorore (bitch slap me later for the lack of french) I never called you back because i was busy Busy cruising around in urlLink LL's '02 Vette . All day Sunday. Busy drinkin beer at the beach. Busy enjoying the sunshine. And then on Monday i was busy again. Writing another song. This one will have to be explained thoroughly, though, because it has to be exactly the way it is in my head. It's complicated and has a couple of extreme tempo changes in it. Words are only vague right now, but the music is all there. Jeff is going to kill me because of the timing changes. And Nick is going to because... GASP there is no guitar solo in it. Oh yeah. and its rather longish.

That would be the direct result of some of my creative writing/ tasty wording!! Just heard Lunar Active's cd myself......I definately dig it-they're awesome. Pril, we shoulda just went to see the F/S guys the other night or something instead, since gussies was so lame....please forgive me for temporary loss of sanity-well, temporary return of self-centeredness, that wasn't cool atall, no wonder you never called me back.... I shall make it up to you, or die trying, whichever you prefer!
WTF?? Someone found this site by googling Orifice Meter Pictures SPLAIN!?
And congratulations to urlLink Lunar Active on the release of your CD, guys. (i'll put a link over on the right eventually).
anyway, the flavoring link wasn't supposed to be here, and i can't remove it cos i blew the code up. So don't bother.
great, now its doing it here.. *sigh*
urlLink The Globe and Mail: Breaking News And this about flavoring from urlLink All About Coffee

Have any of you chicks been clothes shopping lately?? I mean new clothes...I don't do that alot, I'm a thrift store momma, as are the few females I allow near me. But anyways, every once in a while, a girl needs a new pair of pants-not just any pants, but some brand new Levi's ect, something that fits nicely.... So what's the deal with the skank~show faded streaks/front thigh wrinkles...I especially hate the ass fade-horshoe thing. I think that if I wanted to look like a bulimic party orifice, I would, well, be one. heh heh heh...strike one 'gainst the Bimbi...well, look out you over-maintained pretentios 'ho's, cause I saw something that will chill your little artificial hearts. . . Out of desperation, I ventured over to the, well, call it the minivan mom section, I guess, in hopes of escaping the slutfade. Guess what? Thats right, it's finally been long enough that They're starting to don slutfade wear too. And the dangly scarfy belts etc...I'm really pissed about the belts, cause I've always worn those, I like the look, but now I must abstain, as the party ho's have appropriated it....Owell. The minivan moms will swiftly make them uncool again. Then it's just a matter of time, so hold on to your belts out there O wimmen of class! Well, at last I scored a skirt y'all should dig, with minimum fades on it (its a long denim fitted thing) that I may or may not dye over. Nick likes it the way it is...........(.!!dudes!!) But then again, he likes me the way I is, so there's no question he has impeccable judgement! That's the end of the latest adventure, see y'all around!!!!!

ah, well, it seems i have unleashed a sort of monster. No prob. We can say "Powers" in one syllable. "Pee". as in, "I'm going to Pee this weekend, would you like to join me?" Should we go bother the Timberline about playing there? I'd like to have another one of those tomato things they have. It may have to wait till after the 15th tho. (*smacks head against wall repeatedly*). Wanna go to Bald Knob and see some snoooooooow! We will have more fascinating pictures when we can corral some poor schmuck to take them, while we are all in the same place. Some will be gotten on Valentine's Day when we play with the Densmores, of course. (That's 2/14, folks, at Roger's Zoo again, in beautiful downtown North Bend) and more will be taken The Day After (that'd be the 15th, for those of you with swiss cheese where your noodle should be, like me) when we grace the Free Souls with our presence again. At 8 PM. At the clubhouse. Next to the boat. Pass some of those fliers for the Free Souls gig out to your friends, mmmkay? Don't go posting them all over town, cos it is what it is... . And i'll get the List List out probably this week sometime.

Helllll~O Home Slice (s) !!!! I am now the proud owner of a sophomoric attitude, cause of my recent return to higher education. I also have some new vocabulary for evryone....it's my 'efficiency lingo' Kout! (look out) Gway! (self explanatory) Scroff! (screw off!!) Doon? (what are you doing, what the hell do you think your doing ect) I think that most things worth saying can be compressed into one syllable. Like that wonderful town, Powers-aka 'Magical Powers', as Pril, Steven and I like to call it....anyways, we should all aspire to say Powers in one syllable. That's all it deserves heh heh heh. Damn it to hell, when are we going to have more fascinating pictures of ourselves in here? (well, namely, pics of me cause I just don't feel that Christmassy anymore.) I kind of want to bite a bats head off or something...but in a good way...that pretty much describes mah mood as of late. Speaking of moods, Luscious Nick has composed an instrumental entitled 'Tammi's moods'....it's kind of a strange peice, and I'm still debating resenting it...well, y'all, that's about it for now. BYe, and I'll miss you!

well, we flyered our asses off (ooh and got BUSTED for it, but the buck was skillfully passed, so its ok). we told myriad people. we were early and got soundchecked early. the only problem was that april was DOG-SICK and had a terrific case of CRS most of the night (i was just completely not able to concentrate. All i could think of was "i feel like my head is full of blown fiberglass insulation and i hope this blob of snot can stay in my nose for another minute and a half"), but the show went pretty well. The turnout wasn't as high as we'd hoped it would be, and i think that was just because a lot of people stayed home and watched the war. That's weird, isn't it? I certainly wouldn't have wanted to be watching the war if there was live music and good times to be had. So, thanks again to the fine guys at the local chapter of the Free Souls! And thanks to everyone who showed up for showing up!

here it is, my "swan song" flyer.... for the time being at least. Not bad for someone who only recently figured out how to cut & paste heads on people. Oooooo, the fun i could have with some of the band pictures. ehe ... ehehehe.... hmm.
There were some posts here. They shouldn't have been here. I took 'em out.

(Well, i suppose if i got off my butt and cleared out my back room, we would). I've got three songs in various stages of being written.

Here is some non band related stuff for Tam to guffaw over. hehe (i stil laugh when i think of this stuff) Big R and Medium V, when Medium V was uncrushing cans in a speed-induced frenzy. The Ford Ecosystem and Geo Doghouse. Roger's Monkey Dewayne the Dog-detailer. Etta. Keith.

grr. well it may be a week or so before i can strap the bass on properly and do much playing. One of the incisions is right where the strap lays. At last! Thanks, all, it's good to be back. Golf clap? I should say so!! Give y'all a full report later.. l, t p.s. April Stevenson, you are one of the greatly underappreciated persons of the century. Truly a Tortured Genious~thank you for the most generous boon!!

I think we're going to start playing again. Yay! Nick & Tam are gonna die when they hear the 100-pound EFX unit. Except for the nasty hum on it... Oh yes, did i tell you about the EFX box? A friend of mine gave me a Yamaha G50 4 x 10 guitar amp. Something is wrong with it that it doesn't put out as much sound as it should, and it has a nasty hum to it. So i ended up running it between my bass and my bass amp. The Yamaha has some tone controls that the Peavey doesn't- reverb, trem, distortion and some more fiddly knobs i'm still messing with. It also has just enough oomph to really boost the Peavey, so i don't have to drive the bass amp so hard to be heard over Jeff and Nick, now. The Yamaha is rated at 120 watts, and i think i'm only getting about half that out of it. So, now, in total, I'm pushing 130 watts. If i ever fix it, i'll be just over 200. There's just this problem of the hum in it, now. But here's the best part: I can get the Jack Bruce tone without the Jack Bruce mod on the bass, now. *yeeeee*! (stimpyface) ******** Also saw Ea$y Money last night. Boy, have THEY tightened up!

Harborside, the ISP I am with, had some sort of problem last night and I lost TONS of stuff in my remote directory. This included probably half of the pictures. Everything is on my computer, so it's just a matter of getting it all uploaded again and into their directories. everyone else, well, just be patient :) Tschao!

Hi everyone! Well, I must settle into the uncomfortable task of eating my words: I thoroughly enjoyed Chris's new band the Reindawgs at...yes, you guessed it, Gussies...on both friday and saturday this weekend, so I was Way off. sorry gussies! We're not dead. Really. I swear. In fact, we'll be rockin Florence this weekend at... um.. the Bay Bridge Steakhouse, i believe its called, at 1150 Bay St. That's in Old Town Florence, on the water front, right near the bridge. So if you're so unfortunate as to have nothing else to do this weekend, come on up and watch us tear something up. Friday & Saturday night, 9 to 2. Be there or be elsewhere.

Hey, double whammy time. In addition to the gig on the 13th in Coquille, at Tadd's, we've got a two-weekend run over at Gussies in Empire. November 28 & 29, and then again December 5 & 6. So come on down if you're 21 and dance off all that turkey and fixins!
Hey on December 13th we'll be out at Tadd's in Coquille again. That's across the street from the post office! It'll be fun! WooWoo!

I'm terrible. Sometime in July, i got an email from a local guy in a band who wanted to be added to the links over to the right, there ---> Since we hadn't been doing much, due to the CURSED OLCC's new ruling on underage entertainers, i hadn't checked the band's email much. First i wanna thank all the intrepid souls who braved the weather to go to the gig in Coquille. You Rock n Roll party pigs on pizza, you. Then i'm gonna tell you that i think we have a couple of dates coming in january, (and we will be playing some new stuff for these, i think).

Last Sunday the band lost one of its biggest fans. He was in a bike wreck while we were playing that Saturday night, and he didn't make it. Fred- This weekend's for you. I'll have a shot of BV on the amp for ya. We'll all miss you. And who will i dance with, now?

no really, i want to do a family night with the band at the skate rink. Two band members have kids, and most of our friends and frenzied fans do, too. So, while we wouldn't get to play, we could all hang out and have SODA AND PIE. I hope no bad people come. I'm slowly putting that together.... so be patient. Upcoming gigs: In lurvely Winchester Bay at the Oasis. Directions are thusly- go north on 101 from Coos Bay. Pass Hauser. Pass Lakeside. Pass the Umpqua light house. Ok slow down because there's a speed trap in another quarter mile. You need to anyway, because if you go too fast, you'll blow right through Winchester Bay and never even know it. Once you're in Winchester Bay, make a left. Any left. I think there are two. The northernmost left is the one you really should take, though. Once again, go slow, because you won't see the Oasis if you're going toooo fast. If you can't find it, pull over and listen. Follow the din. Anyway, that's March 6. That's a Saturday. We're on from 9 to 2 or 2:30 or so.

well, DAMM. Blogger finally let me back. I couldn't get the login page loaded for weeks! Pah. As of yet, no shows are planned for Feb. But January went fantastic! Boy, the one weekend we did play, we had a nice-sized crowd. Thanks everyone who showed up! That's: People from Wal-Mart, ACS, fans of Pril's blog, folks from the Cap'ns Cabin, folks from Everywhere! That was so cool and we all really dug it- which you may have been able to tell if you were there. The more people, the spazzier we are. Everyone seems to adore the new songs we came out with. Hope we get that same sort of reception when we finally roll out one of ours. I know- i've been going on about these so-called originals for a while, but i think the time has finally come that there's some seriousness about it. heeey- in March or April, the band will have been together for two years. That's pretty cool. I think we should celebrate it somehow. maybe a party at the skate rink! rofl

Alright, well, the Oasis is a rockin little place. Had a good time. You people need to stay the hell off the stage though if you're going to be pulling your pants down, mmmkay? You do that outside or something. I'm not interested. I'll KICK YOU next time. And if you have a problem with THAT, we can go outside, and then i'll come back in and play some more bass. Oh yeah, and bring your fat little boyfriend out with you, so i can kick HIS ass too. Anyway.

Alright... Happy Humpday! (Um, Wednesday , you sick pervs) I have not gotten around to fixing the links to the pictures of us, BUT, elsewhere, i have something hidey-like for a lot of the pics that get taken with my camera. If you go urlLink here , you'll get to see a lot of "candid" pics of the band members, some of other bands we're friends with, the flyers for the band, pictures of Coos Bay and North Bend, etc. It's a catchall for the interesting pictures, so go peep.
Nothing set up for May. Or June. Or July. In the meantime, folks like urlLink Bobby Lindstrom , urlLink Sam & John Densmore , and various other people are playing around the county. Regularly.

nothing coming up in May that i know of for the band. However, by the end of this year, i hope to have something done with Ol' urlLink Beeb that i've been slowly putting together. All i need is for ONE of my electric guitars to work and some time with the Lambaster of Locals. I do believe six songs is enough for an EP type thing? And.. residents of Lakeside- invest in ear plugs, cos if you bitch to me, i'm just gonna turn it up LOUDER. Note to everyone else: Stop asking about the fork embedded in my ass cheek.
June 25 and 26 we will be at Lloyd's in Bandon. That's in old town Bandon. HUGE place. very cool. And as mentioned, 4th of July weekend at The Oasis in Winchester Bay.
Folks! JOE was here! Some may remember JOE from the Weapons of Musical Destruction Home Invasion Tour of 2001. Joe, drop a note to manifestlist@musician.org, wouldja bro?!

Here it is a Wednesday, and we have NEWS. The 11th and 12th at the Oasis is off. That's right. No gig. Go out and bust the chops of a whiny bitch (of either gender, preferably male) for us. We hate them even more than ever before. Losing that one, though, landed us in the best one we could have gotten. Fourth of July weekend at The Oasis. That's the 2nd and 3rd of July-the 4th being a Sunday this year and all. It's a weekend of MANY, MANY happenings up and down the coast, including a festival in just about every single town from Florence to Brookings. So screw all that and come to Winchester Bay to see us. We got what you need.

wow Blogger has made some neat little changes. Coming Up: Not only the Oasis in August (12th & 13th, Winchester Bay ), but we got a slot at the Coos County Fair in Myrtle Point on July 31. 4-5 Pm. Oh yeah its only an hour... but i'm lookin at it this way. It's only an hour of the hot, miserable mugginess that MP is this time of year. It'll be loads of fun! Just prior to us going on there are going to be things like alligators and lizards nearby. The Little River Band is the headlining band at the fair this year. Site stuff: When i changed the template i lost all the links that were on it. So a call to any Coos County bands who come across this place to drop a note at manifestlistATmusicianDOTorg with your link. I'll see about finding as many as i can. Ooh, am i getting nutty with the bold or what? tee hee.

Two things: Site's gonna change looks and We are gonna be back at the Oasis in Winchester Bay on August 13 and 14. Bring your lucky charms. Follow the bass player home, and watch as she gets pulled over. For the 8th time this year. Indeed. No ... really... we have found if someone pulls over with me, the cops let me go. Why do they pull me over? We don't know. Shits and giggles on the part of law enforcement, i suppose.

It was only warm, but muggy. Of course it was 20 degrees hotter on the stage we were on than anywhere else. Of course, no one had even the vaguest idea of which stage we were supposed to go to or where it was. (not just band members.... FAIR STAFF). Of course the first thing i did upon arrival and unloading was SMASH THE SHIT out of one of my fretting fingers. Of course that still hurts like a mofo. Um and we were pretty damn good i gotta say. Oh and clickie clickie on my profile over by the contributors thingay, cos there's a really freakin rad picture of me there. I mean, pictures of me this good roll around once a century. Damn i look good.

A dozen years or so of cultural flimflam passed me right by. I sometimes feel like Death must have when he went for a visit. I don't relate with most pop culture unless it has something to do with music. Speaking of Death.... there's something very strange about Death being a virgin. You can call me... RumpelPRILskin.

ok. Blastin the Posies and the Toadies for a shot of "aaarrgh" for this afternoon. Got Xtra Super Strong coffee on (and steaming down my gullet). Preparations for fried egg sammiches on toast, with toast on the side, are underway. I have my clothes laid out. My hair is a fine scarlet. I got some sleep. Bass is ready to go. Tuner: Check. Drums are ready to go. Amp is not yet unplugged. I'm not nearly half this freakish when we play. I have no idea why this one-hour show at the county fair has me all wound up. but I'm Ready To Rock.

/me looks at you with a cocked eyebrow, twirling her coffee cup in her hand. Yes my dear Pril, it was almost a ... "spiritual experience". I think that cup twirling is kind of like signing the cross right?

four... count 'em.. four (um give or take a few minutes) glorious hours of *TLAVK. The last bit of Thunderheart, all of Red Planet, and almost all of Tombstone (again). I really don't understand the Wyrdlings' attraction to that Cro-Magnon, Vin Diesel. She must have dropped them on their heads when they were babies or something. *The Always Luscious Val Kilmer

Then I stuck my finger in my eye. Oh, it's not just selling THINGS or YOURSELF. It's not mere politics. It's RELIGION BABY. My religion requires FAITH and HOPE. And lots and lots of EYE LINER. It's fun though. Is religion supposed to be fun? Am I doing something WRONG HERE?

Yesterday I was subjected to propaganda. How To Sell Crap type propaganda. Or, it could have been any speech by any politician. Any idiot on the phone who i did not ask to call me. There are proven methods to selling your stuff, your ideas, your platform, your self. They are interchangeable. You consider yourself a savvy shopper? Look what else you're buying. Look what other slop you're happily eating. You bought it. It's crap. You like it anyway. You like it because it's cool to like it. It doesn't matter if it tastes like cardboard and looks like reconstituted bloodmeal worms, everyone else says it's good so you eat it. You pishpaw the peer pressure and your peers are all drinking the same lukewarm swill as you. You can never escape it, and you will never escape it. "Better than them" is an addiction and you're the hype. We will always be around to sell you things you don't need, and we can always convince you to buy them because you NEED them. Everyone else does, and if they aren't buying it too, they just don't know any better.

I'm talking about YOU. With the out of state plates. Driving your house around. You may have noticed as you entered the state, BIG GREEN SIGNS that say you are to stay in the right lane unless you're passing. Ignore this at your peril. You make me pass on the right, I'll dig around behind my seat and find something, some slimy thing or some big thing, and throw it at YOUR LAME ASS as I speed past you. Thank you.

I was never really a drooling Bratt Pitt fan, but i gotta say, "Meet Joe Black" might have turned me into one. I think perhaps *TALVK would have suited the part well, too. *The Always Luscious Val Kilmer
Well, Wyrd, it's all about me . Unless of course, it's you . Then it's all about you . But otherwise it's all about me .

I am relentlessly pursuing the relentless. Pril say's I've been getting a little Wyrd lately. I blame the Shrek Gummi Things. I think they are smart pills in disguise. I eat one, and everything becomes PERFECTLY CLEAR.

Isn't our every move Self Promotion? Do you promote yourself in a favorable, or detrimental way? Let it Burn into your Brain. Eat with it. Sleep with it. Then take it out to play tomorrow and tell me what you come up with.

About a week ago a kid with liberty spikes and a dead kennedys shirt asked where i got my hair color. He about fainted when i told him Wal-Mart. I guess he went and told all his friends, cos now there's an awful lot of kids around town with the Fuschia Flash hair. Time for something different for me i guess. Yeesh.
I'm totally stoked, man. I have my first real bass student. woohoo! And its another girl !

Ok, new game. AVON Jeopardy. Categories: Adventures in Leadership The âOtherâ AVON People Common Mistakes District Managers Often Make What is: Is that a donut through your nose or my finger? Ok, so like Iâm tired of that one already. How bout; How many AVON ladies does it take to man a fair booth? Answer: Two, one to greet the people and one to open the beer.
My children love my movie choices. Example: Derek: "Well that's an hour out of my life I won't ever get back".

Ok well it's been like a month since Nth of Pril went down the tubes. In the meantime, i've been entertaining myself til it hurts. Tam and i have spent a total of about 12 hours in the luxury yacht. (that's canoe to you city folks). It shows. I missed the cardboard boat races. Was just too lazy to go outside. It got warmish here. Some might say hot, but the worst part wasn't the hot, it was the humid. Then we got slapped with hurricane force winds. Typical. Tam and I invented and worked on a setlist for our new project, T&A Productions Co, Inc, LLC, Etc. A veritable entertainment conglomerate. You'll see. The Wyrd one and I have plotted and schemed, but the world is still not our oyster. Don't worry, you'll soon be on the BBQ, floating in butter-garlic-tobasco-parmesan sauce. Greatest garage sale find in years... "Asterix bei der Schweizen" . For a dollah! For Dale and I, reading this is like being five years old and being given a big book full of big words. We both excelled at German in high school, but having not used it regularly in a good 10 years or so, even a basic comic book is a slog. Good stuff, though.

It's really just too bad they can't decriminalize pot for the months leading up to the election. 1. Stunts gag reflexes, making it possible to vote without vomiting all over the booth. 2. Feeling of well-being, to offset the feeling that no matter who you vote for, you're just screwed. 3. Removes any bits of guilt that might be left over after voting with your concience instead of your party. 4. Makes you hungry, and able to order "Potatoes prepared in the Belgian manner" with a straight face.

I think I'm deaf. I wish Hillary would stop yelling. It scares me. You know, this Friday is the Full Thunder Moon. I shall hereby refer to it as "The Hillary Moon". Perhaps that should be capitalized and in bold for emphasis.

oh did i mention yet that i watched part of the DNC on the tee-vee tonight? It was all "blah blah blah John Kerry blah blah". Just like that Far Side cartoon about what you say to your dog vs. what your dog hears. Of course, i'm sure the RNC will be similar, except it'll be "Blah blah blah George Bush blah blah". And all the people will look, or did look, like they are expectantly waiting for the sacred Kool-Aid. My questions: Will Jesse Jackson ever learn how to speak? Will Hillary ever speak in a manner less than completely condescending? What's with the goofy hats?

Not too long ago my little spot, Nth of Pril, simply disappeared. It was slightly more complicated than that, but that's all anyone needs to know. So this weirdo i know, she and i cooked up this plan for this thing you're staring at. There may or may not be the old usually incoherent rants emanating from this little corner of the round room. It depends on how busted we get for mentioning one of the myriad ways we manage to avoid time clocks, dress codes, middle management, service industries, lunch breaks, 10 minute rest breaks, bosses staring over our shoulders, piss tests and people screaming about deadlines. Yeah, you know, at some point, you just look at that crap and go, "Screw this". That'd be my introduction. Or, reintroduction, as the case may be. But wait! There's more! I also play bass in urlLink this band . And I spend a lot of time typing, mostly off line.
one of us dropped out for a while. one of us kept plugging along. here we both are.
Will dissuade us from our mission. We perform as a Unit on Friday's. We work together. Sometimes we get to play together afterwards. It's our way.

well isnt that the most disgusting irony. The only ads i ever see in the adbox are for the pink people. Only one thing needs to be said... AVON has over a hundred shades of lipstick. The pink people do not. Can you buy toys through the pink people ? NOOOoooOOOO. Can you buy diecast models of Elvis' favorite cars from the pink people ?! NoOoOoO. Can you buy 1:24 diecast classic Harleys? NASCAR slippers? Popeye watches? NOOOOO! Do the pink people have things for dudes? Of course not. Would you rather aim for oooh... one of three cars chosen by the company of pink people , or would you rather aim for... an $800/month car allowance? With which you can buy.. pretty much whatever freakin car you please! I rest my case!

Went and hung out with my beauty parlor friend. I gave her pretty stuff and she trimmed my hair for free. I told her she could sell for me if it behooved her. You could tell she was thinking about it but then she says, no, you get to do it. So I have my own lovely shelf and managed to hand out a few brochures to customers who asked for them. She put neat stuff in my hair. I'm goin to her reception Sunday, a party of course. A girl's gotta do what a girl's gotta do.

As i await the arrival of one of my custies to collect her order, i'm sitting with my bass and engaging in some eye-candy watching. Saw 12 monkeys last night. Rather frustrating ending. I was all up in arms about it. A Terry Gilliam movie, so of course it was totally weird. The local video store does not have True Romance. I was disappointed. Even more disappointed that the hipster at the counter, Mr. Tarantino fan, had no idea it existed, and was looking in the Romance section for it. I'm all.. Dude... i'm pretty sure its not a romance, it being by Tarantino and all. I must see the movie though, because i have not yet. Recently someone said they weren't into things like Mary Kay and AVON parties. Au contraire, mon sorore! (Um yeah i suck at french!). You think George Bush is evil? You maybe think John Kerry is evil? You're wrong. WRONG WRONG WRONG. I know evil. She's my AVON upline, and the other contributor. Never have i met a woman so deserving of my admiration in the manipulative arts. I love a girl with a gun in her hand and a party on her mind.

well, not really. Just dusting off the furniture at the urlLink old place and there you can once again experience the pril who is not acting. Because, yes, i am an AVON INDEPENDENT SALES REPRESENTATIVE (!!), it's like... a part. And i'm in a movie, see. Like the whole rock star thing- that's another part. And also the good wife... another character role.

mmkay. i have to NOT RANT on this one. Perhaps i should go back to the original nth so i can rant in peace. so anyway i took the rants down because they are unbecoming of an avon rep. pft.

I'm a rooster. I can't help it. I was born in the year of the Rooster. I tend more toward the masculine descriptions of Roosters than the feminine, too. I only say this because i keep opening up the picture of me thats on my profile and cackling with glee at it because i like it so much. You could call this being an egotist or something similar, and you'd probably be right. But hey, when you go through 34 years with only probably one really great picture of you once every three years, (although i think this year i've had two...) you really dig it when there's a good one. Some lucky jerks are so photogenic that nearly every shot of them is fantastic. They will never know the feeling of "Good Lord, i had no idea i was so good looking. Must be the light or something. " I can't stop looking at myself. It's insane. When i was about 4 my mom took me to Sears for some portraits. Gramma was with us. Gramma was appalled because i was dirty. Typically dirty, for me. I was a filthy little child. So there was this series of pictures taken of me, with my always bad hair and some smears of dirt under my nose. My mom likes to say, "It's you. You weren't a clean kid, and we could never keep you clean. You were happiest in mud. If you had been clean in the picture, it wouldn't have properly reflected you at that time." And so i will leave you with this, seen on a sign around town: "Be yourself" is bad advice to give some people.

Another case i remember being bombarded with when i was growing up, this one while i was in middle school. The Laurel Canyon murders as they were known at the time, The Wonderland murders as they seem to have morphed into. I was about 11... i had no idea who John Holmes was, y'know? "Adult film star" didn't have much meaning, either. I watched Wonderland last night. Ok i rented it cos it's a Val Kilmer movie! So kill me. But it was trippy. He did a good job as a lying, sniveling piece of shit basefiend. And i've known enough of them in my time to know exactly what sort of subhumans they are. Which brings an interesting thing up. At times in the movie, you feel profoundly sorry for the Holmes character. I mean, you go, "jeez, dude, if you could only see yourself". Other times, you wonder how someone like that managed to stay alive long enough to be such a sheister. You could kill him yourself for showing his weasely face. So now i have a little more understanding of that particular LA murder case, and the Onion Field one. I have no real desire to learn anything more about the OJ one. My homesickness seems to manifest itself by the need to watch movies filmed in or about Los Angeles and the psychos, freaks and weirdness that have inhabited its landscape for the past 100 years. Someday, i'll get back there. Til then i continue my love/hate relationship with it from Oregon.
and i don't care what any one says. i liked ABBA when i was a kid. I think i still do like them. You know how hard that is to admit for someone who had a 17" mohawk when she was 17?

i woke up this morning and i got myself a beer. er.. not really. I didn't even wake up this morning. I woke up around 1. the future's uncertain and the end is always near Does anyone over 30 ever stop and think, "whoa, the 80s were weird, frightening times, despite all the pretty colors and good drugs"?

i've had this song stuck in my head all day. I've had the Jane's Addiction version stuck. I'm listenin to it right now, too... ARTIST: Rolling Stones TITLE: Sympathy for the Devil Yow! Yow! Yow! i'm very happy to say that the bohunk town i live in does not have a Starbuck's. Blasphemy! I hear from the ranks of the urban cool. Fuck that. I've had the stuff. We are not impressed. Besides, there are a lot of local people who have little 'spresso drive-thrus, and i'll happily continue to take my money there, if a Starbuck's should ever appear locally. Last time Dale and i were in Los Angeles, we counted Starbucks on PCH/Katella between Long Beach and Disneyland. Some 25 of them. Overkill? You decide.

Check out that Life in Armenia link. Very cool one. There's another one here that makes me wish i could read Farsi, just so i could see what it says. I've been invited to tell the tale of how and why i joined TCFX on a guitar players site, Guitarnoise.com. That's a great site, though, so check it out. TCFX stands for Too Cool For Chris. Chris was the main thing keeping me from joining these guys a year ago. It started because there is this maroon 84 Camaro roaming around town, with pink and sky blue pinstripes, and its so cheesy looking, and on the rear spoiler fin it says "Too Cool 4 U" or something. I freakin laugh every time i see it. Prime example of the Oregon genus of Dorkus Maximus. Somehow, though, Tam and i thought it was a killer band name. TC4X? We're going to do Fortunate Son. Its been an obsession of mine ever since i started playing music, that some day i would be in a band and we would do Fortunate Son. the irony would be lost if there was a male singer. We have a female singer. And on top of that, the song just seems to fit the times. Kinda like, just after we started bombing Afghanistan, we jammed on Universal Soldier up at the tavern one night. Never understood the "need" to play a certain song. My friend Mike (now Mike Odd of Rosemary's Billygoat) was obsessed with playing "Earache My Eye" when we were in High School. He got to, on his first album "Pizza of Doom". Check them out. But anyway, i understand now.

Is it me, or is there a ton of self-concious soul-searching going on in blogs? Damn. I already did all that. I'm the weird one again. I wrote this song, probably another of my terrible bits, about the 11th. I've showed it to people. They like it. It's only lyrics. I know how i want it to sound. I don't know what the chords in my head are called, though. I hate that. I think i'm getting to where i can stand looking at the thing again, and maybe do some work on it. anyway its always really funny when i sing with Beeb. I love art. Entertainment is an art. I never thought i was any good at, and still sort of question the whole thing, but people dig what i do, even my singing, and i'm certainly not going to take them down for their taste, or lack of it, or whatever. The new band makes me sing a bit.. gawd i'm so bad at singing, too.. you can't even imagine. For now, until a real name is decided on, i'm going to stop calling the new band 'the new band' and call them TCFX. They don't have to know. they can't decide on a freakin name themselves. i have a picture online somewhere of the band. before i joined up.

ok ok so there are tow of these... Anyone i know will tell you i am one of these. oodles of folk have these, so here's my concession to the madness- Celeborn If I were a character in The Lord of the Rings , I would be Celeborn, Elf, King of Lothlorien, husband of Galadriel and grandfather of Arwen. In the movie, I am played by Marton Csokas . Who would you be? Zovakware Lord of the Rings Test with Perseus Web Survey Software A sun shiney day outside. Like a Partridge Family sun shiney kinda day. C'mon, get happy! Mostly a collective shrug of the shoulders at most of the names i wrote down. Almost a whole page! Extreme disinterest in Vaporlock as a band name. I hate not having one, though. Might have to use Too Cool for X anyway. Yay i finally got another printer cartridge, so now i can print the flyers and entry forms for the regatta thing, print out the lyrics and tab for some of the songs we do.. gotta have the lyrics, i need that point of reference. i think today i'll hole up and play my bass and violin for a bit. Nick wants to play the greenie sometime, so i'll drop it off down there one day when we practice. I'm a pretty uninteresting person. I just play my bass and i'm married. I live in a town next to another town with a combined population of just around 25,000 people. Sometimes i hate it. Sometimes i can't imagine leaving it. I have an ocean, dunes, mountains, a river, a wild river, forests- all mine to play in. Well, not really, but you know what i mean. I wish i could canoe more than i get to. Last time i canoed, we pulled the thing off the truck too fast and lost it (caught it again before it hit the ground and busted up, though) and sheared off the mirror on the driver's side. Damn dealership wants $55 for a new one! So i found one on ebay and got it for $36. Deal. Sometimes i read the paper and wonder what the hell is going on, and when, if ever, is it going to stop. What are we, dumbasses?
well, damn. I'm still trying to figure out how to fill the little goodies in here. I have band practice in about 20 minutes, and am fast running out of patience, here.

Yay got to spend time with Dale today. He got his A+ certification in the mail today, so we went out and got a nice frame for it. So damn cool. Last night's jam at the tavern was particularly awful. I just couldn't pull it together. But some other people showed up, and they were great. I took our drummer up there (drummer from the new band) cos the dude just needs to get out of the house more than he does and he got good and trashed, and got to play drums all night because the other drummer wasn't there. Nubs was late, because he didn't realize anyone was going to play, and when he walked in, EVERYONE clapped, so i'm sure that shocked the shit out of him. What else. Two in the new band agree that Vaporlock is a good band name. we have to run it by the rest and see if it flies. I got pictures back from my trip to St. Augustine. hehehe. yikes. But they're family pics, and we never get those because we all live all over the country.

Great! My third shot at this, and i think it may finally prove satisfactory. Here is my first ever Blogger post. Nothing really on my mind today. I've had sort of a whirlwind week, I guess. Working, practicing with the new band, playing with the old band, bouncing ideas around for the First Annual Mighty Millicoma River Regatta coming up in August, trying to sleep, trying to stay awake, forgetting to do necessary things like return a borrowed CD and entering transactions in Quicken. Willfully neglecting doing my taxes, since i will again have to pay an insane amount of money to a government i didn't vote for, don't approve of.. etc. Regarding that whole mess, and what else could you possibly call it, i can only quote Johnny Rotten- "Did you ever get the feeling you've been cheated?". I've been listening to a terrific rap song that came out in the early 90s lately. By the Disposable Heroes of Hiphoprisy, this particular song appeared on an Alternative Tentacles Compilation of Dead Kennedy's songs. DHoH covered "California Uber Alles", and man, it's wonderfully scathing. It came out around the time Pete Wilson was running, or pondering running, for President. I was living in Los Angeles for awhile before this, having returned home from Nashville in 1992 (or was it '91? Hard to remember, i only recall events, not necessarily dates), one day after the Big Riot.I stayed for a year before heading to Arizona, where another good year or so passed before i heard this song. I never liked Governor Wilson, and i was appalled that he would make the run for prez. I have an assortment of adventures to write about, and a plethora of opinions to spout, and a large selection of oddball tidbits i throw in occasionally. I started keeping on online journal sometime in 1998. It has mostly been removed, and redone, and this would be the latest incarnation of it. So, enjoy. Or don't.

no really, i'm going to bed now. If you should happen to drop in, go past the stupid quiz things. I was bored today. There might actually be something interesting to look at. Who knows. i wanna see some new stuff on my site meter thingie, dangit. there is a woman, up at the tavern.. we'll call her poof. She likes to tell stories. The one i heard today, from someone else, i also heard come out of her mouth, and its a funny one. Because i'm directly involved and it's completely a lie. last year i drove my band members (before they were my band members, when neurotic chris was still in the band) up to the tavern in a borrowed limo. I gave this poof person a ride in the limo while the band was playing. Then she goes and tells everyone that she knows stephen king, and it was his limo, and he was in it that night. What the? I go up there all the time.. she's telling people this, and its getting back to me, and i'm fuckin rollin about it.. YEAH! i should ask her how ol' stephen is doing. then we should borrow the limo again. rofl.

i still have not totally recovered from this last weekend. Canoeing this coming one, on the high tide, around 4, so that will give me a chance to do stuff i need to beforehand, and maybe get some stretching in, else i'll feel like the truck-slamming victim again. Its usually fairly easy to canoe, but we haven't gone upriver yet. The last few times its been downriver, with the tide. Or at slack. This time, we need to get the canoe upriver, so we were trying to get a good high tide. This weekend promises a good one. Maybe we'll just go up past the tavern to the store and then back down again. Hell, from the tavern to the place the canoe is at now is 6 road miles.. who knows how many water miles it was, since the river lopes so much. anyway, this little monkey's going to bed. Weird, since i'm never asleep before 2 anymore. must.... sleep..
