urlLink Gabby has finished his six-part "The Day The Music Died". I said it in your comments Gabs, and i'm saying it again. Don't stop writing the blog . And i want to add, read up on this guy: urlLink Mike Watt . (the link i promised) Here's some background for you about him: The Minutemen were three childhood friends from glorious San Pedro CA. As teens, they started a band. They knew nothing about playing. It became one of the very best punk bands that ever came out of Los Angeles (which, depending on your outlook about that type of music, could mean various things). in 1986, D. Boon, Watts best friend and the singer of the Minutemen was killed in a car accident. Watt was adrift after that. Then some crazy guy named Ed, in Ohio, started calling him and talking about a band, thinking about the band, and then Ed flew out to Pedro, and they formed fIREHOSE while Ed was living in Watt's living room with George Hurley, the Minutemen's drummer. The music was different. A lot different. But it was still there. Maybe i'm wrong, but i don't think the muse just flees us. I think she hides a lot, i think she puts on different costumes or forces us to pick up a paintbrush or a pencil instead of a guitar, and i think she changes from her bright shimmering to darkness, making her harder to find. I think she puts on that darkness when we need her to, when we need to explore some part of ourselves that we haven't paid attention to or is new somehow and unpleasant. When you've been in the sunlight, the dark is even darker. I dunno why i'm writing this. I can only say that to a certain point i can commiserate with Gabby. Different stuff, for sure, but i've felt that kind of sickening emptiness of being unable to do what i do.. write or draw or whatever. I mean, its what i do , and the times that i haven't been able to have been worse than anything else thrown at me.

urlLink bigsugar.com :: the official Big Sugar website Because i love THESE guys soooo much, and they almost NEVER come to the US (as much as the small collection of a dozen or so diehard, drooling US fans like me plead and cajole), i just have to expose you to them. Again, probably. Since i was born, much has been written about the death and rebirth of rock n roll. Well folks, here it is. What you've been waiting for. The Rebirth. I distinctly remember my first dose of Gordie and the band. I was in Nashville. Early 1992. One night, after working at Sears putting tires on 4 x 4 s all day and replacing batteries, i walked home, cracked a cheap beer, nuked up a box of corndoglets and fell onto the couch in my apartment. Which just happened to actually be someone else's basement. Anyway. I flip on MTV, because MTV was still relatively cool... they were showing Ren & Stimpy at the time, and 120 minutes. It was during one of the shows they were doing, the kind that focused on new or interesting music, that i heard the first sweet chords to Ride Like Hell and Dear M. F. (yes. that's a cover of the Status Quo song Dear Mr. Fantasy). I was hooked. Line and sinker, that was the end of that. My jaw was dropped. my beer tipped in my slack hand, dripping onto the concrete floor. THERE WAS NO REWIND! I could not live that moment over and over again... no... i was crushed. Move ahead about two years, to Arizona. Perhaps 3. I can't be sure anymore. I had recently met my sweetie and he was working at KASU in Tempe. He invited me to come out to the station with him sometime and help him pick music. Ohhellyeah, i'm all over THAT. I was rummaging through the CDs, pulling out cool ones and sort of tossing them at him. One was Maggie Estep's "Fuck Me". (He got in some trouble for playing that. We laughed.) Then my hands fell upon the "Dear M.F." EP. "DALEJESUSCHRIST Do you realize what a freakin rad band this is? I've only heard two songs from them but you gotta think if THOSE two songs were as fantastic as they were, what's the rest of it like?" We played Dear M.F. on the air. I told him it should be his theme song. Moving onward another four years or so, Dale and I are here, in Oregon. I'm listening to a tape with "Dear M.F." on it. I'm pining for more. I'm thinking, gawd, ain't about time i went out and FOUND some BS stuff?! And so i did, and once again, that was the end of me. I now have everything by them i could find, including a few bootlegs and live performances. No other band matters. I like a lot of music, a lot of bands, but nothing, i mean NOTHING, has whatever it is that Gordie and Big Sugar have. I feel there is hope for modern rock still, as long as bands like Big Sugar are making music. Moment of smugness: This is one band that i have introduced a ton of people to, of all walks of life, all ages, all tastes in music. Not one of them has not like Big Sugar. Not one of them has not asked if they ever play in the US. Not one of them has NOT asked me for more, or gone out and bought a CD after listening to them. Its one of those bands. And, if you find yourself disgusted by what you hear on the radio, if the songs all melt together in one big downtuned orgy of shoegazing, raphappy monotony, or give you seizures with a funky trance beat that makes your eyeballs pound with your heartbeat, this is a band you should listen to. Pardon my pomposity! I feel very strongly about this issue. Oh yeah. I don't give a rat's ass that they released albums in French. I think its cool as hell. Gordie makes French sound good. Je suis cool! (although the production for the french version is a lot different than the production for the english one)

urlLink Dogtown Journal I'm not sure what brings me back to this particular blog. Sometimes i read it and think, "Dude, what if your wife had a blog?" Not sure why i think that. I just do. Sometimes i want to grab him by the collar and tell him to get his wife to a freaking doctor , whether she wants to go or not. Therapy, meds, groups, something, anything. How many of us might identify with this guys wife? Even from the short descriptions of her? Personally, i understand what it means to say "I'm sad and i don't know why". Sad is perhaps not the right word, though. Maybe "I'm drowning" is more apt. Something like this: i think i'm suffering from chronic, acute apathy. The numbness is generalized in no specific mental distribution. It wakes me up at night. It keeps me from getting a good night's sleep. Getting up seems to aggravate it. Alcohol, playing music and cuddling and sunshine help to alleviate it. It is a dull, mindnumbing apathy, sometimes sharp and ugly. It interferes in my activities of daily living. On a scale of 1 to 10, it is usually a 6, though it can be as high as a 9 and as low as a 3. It feels like i'm wandering around with a wet burka on my head, and occasionally i feel like i've high-centered myself with both axles. Self-medicating is no longer fun or interesting, but still i cling to it. Addendum: I just wanna add that i'm not condemning the writer of Dogtown Journal. I think he's doing about the best he can in his situation. But i think there comes a point where helping someone you love means actively doing something to get them help, even outside the confines of family and church. I don't know if he has or not, i don't recall him mentioning it. Feeling the way his wife does is as frustrating as dealing with someone who feels like that. It's like, you know something is not right, and you can't put your finger on it, and it's infuriating to not be able to pinpoint what's getting at you. And then you feel even worse about it because you can't escape it. I read his journal anymore and i can't help but think of urlLink gabby and HIS experience with something similar.

every single day, i'm stunned to see people plastering a label on themselves and then tromping around calling themselves independent thinkers. Especially, y'know, when everything that falls out of their mouths is the gospel of their chosen politics. You folks are all insane. All y'all. Insane, hypocrites, blind monkeys on leashes. I know i know i harp on this all the time, but all the time i have to read and hear and watch the blathering and ranting of all these cookie cutters- it all sounds the same. Got that? On one side its THE JEWS, on the other side its the FAGS, on another its... the enemy du jour. Cripes, people, get a fucking grip already. They have pills for this kind of shit you know. You won't get what you want! Ever! No one owes you anything! Oh hmm yeah i keep hearing about this lack of employment thing... true nuff, i'm sure. So start your own business and shut up. Why the hell you want some funky boss looking over your shoulder all day, be at work at some crapass time, wimper at your paychecks. three years ago i saw this guy cruisin around town in a battered orange van with a lawnmower strapped to the back. Now he's got a nursery and three new trucks, a fine landscaping business. So, i don't buy it. Create a job for yourself. Create the need and fill it. Take a risk. Obviously the corporate buffoons don't give a crap about you anyway, why work for any of them?

wow what a cool thing to wake up to on a saturday morning! Antique airplanes landing at the Lakeside muni strip. They were at an air show in cottage grove and dropped by. When planes land at the strip, they aren't much more than 500 feet above. Got some neat pictures of them landing from the porch. Some of them flew in formation before they landed, too. Wow was it ever a gearhead's dream here this morning. Most of them had 10 cylinders. Some quiet, please, as i imagine cramming 10 cyliners under the hood of my toyota.

Something you should be warned about.... The discontinuity thing here. For a year i posted elsewhere, and that elsewhere is gone. Many thoughts on various things were pounded out here, and many changes in how i think were, also. Some of them changed again at the now-gone place, where they were again pounded out. If you read through these archives, you might be a bit confused as to who i really am, especially if you only came across me before at the other place. Well, this is me. That was me. The archives are me. Consistency is the last refuge of the unimaginative. I am inconsistent, but i have some core ethics that seem to veer extremely widely from what's generally accepted as okay. You gotta know that right now or everything here and there will just piss you off and you won't be able to think up enough names to call me. And even if you did, i'd just smile and nod and laugh at you. Don't be taking my inventory when yours is in disarray, either. Now then... it will also take me a good while to get this thing looking halfway decent, get the right links back up and running, get the colors nonblinding. I run the band blog, and contribute on another one, and they all need babysitting as well. The House of Nth is about to undergo an extensive, very slow, renovation. Watch for nails, put on a mask, and be prepared to swing a hammer.
